In actions that would affect more than 6.5 million California students, state lawmakers are poised to make ethnic studies a graduation requirement in high school and at Cal State universities. The high school requirement ‚Äî the first such in the nation, according to a legislative analysis ‚Äî appears to have broad backing among Sacramento lawmakers and beyond. At its core, supporters say, ethnic studies classes teach students how to think critically about the world around them, ‚Äútell their own stories,‚Äù develop ‚Äúa deep appreciation for cultural diversity and inclusion‚Äù and engage ‚Äúsocially and politically‚Äù to eradicate bigotry, hate and racism. üì∏: @kentnish

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the biggest show in the country,‚Äù said Pam Schnebelen, 75, one of a record crowd of ardent cactus fans who attended the Inter-city Cactus & Succulent Show & Sale over the weekend. Officer Lojann Dennison, a 20-year veteran with the Navajo Nation Police Department, patrols one of seven districts on a Navajo reservation that's home to 180,000 people. 
The Navajo are among the few with their own police force. That means Navajo patrolling Navajo, with aspects of the job far outside typical rural policing: She struggles with deeply rooted customs that can call for an officer to choose between allegiance to clan ties and upholding the law. Female officers such as Dennison are a key part of the department‚Äôs approach to one of the toughest policing jobs in America. They can be more effective than men in handling abuse against women, which is pervasive here, experts say. Although female officers have made strides within the department, Dennison says true equality still eludes them. üì∏: Randi Lynn Beach

Comedy is Seth MacFarlane‚Äôs forte, but when it comes to politics, he‚Äôs a serious money man. At @museumofdeathofficial in Hollywood, Manson and his notorious ‚Äúfamily‚Äù have a place of honor in the 3,000-square-foot collection, where they claim more prominent real estate than nearly any other deathly display. In fact, now that it‚Äôs the anniversary, one thing is clear: Interest in Manson isn‚Äôt heightened, because it‚Äôs never really gone away. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been doing this for 25 years,‚Äù said Eric Holler, who sells murderous memorabilia said he supplied the museum‚Äôs New Orleans branch with a set of original Ted Bundy courtroom sketches. ‚ÄúManson has been the top seller for 25 years. For Walmart manager Robert Evans, a night out to the El Paso Chihuahuas game was intended to be a few hours of peace after the mass shooting that happened at his store last Saturday. Evans saw the first bullets fly and ran into the store, yelling ‚Äúactive shooter!‚Äù He was the last store employee to leave the scene after being interviewed by investigators. But days later, Evans was standing on the field at the first home game for the Chihuahuas since the shooting. The team was honoring him for helping to save people from the shooter. During the game, his mind wandered back to the shooting, but in a moment that made him smile, a rainbow appeared beyond the stadium. ‚ÄúI love baseball,‚Äù he said quietly after the game. üì∏: Rudy Gutierrez

When news broke this week that the billionaire who owns the parent company of luxury gym Equinox and fitness company SoulCycle would be hosting a fundraiser for President Trump, the fitness community did not take to it kindly. Ten years ago, @BarbaraDemick traveled through central China to learn more about the origins of the more than 80,000 girls who had been adopted in the United States. @moca recently acquired 
@xuzhenmadein‚Äôs ‚ÄúIn Just a Blink of an Eye‚Äù for its permanent collection. Once seen as a bastion of Republican supporters in Southern California, Orange County has now officially flipped blue. The county that nurtured Ronald Reagan‚Äôs conservatism and is the resting place of Richard Nixon is now home to 547,458 registered Democrats, compared with 547,369 Republicans. Democratic leaders attributed the shift to changing demographics, aggressive recruitment efforts and President Trump. üì∑: @alschaben

This week was one for the record books in Palm Springs as temperatures peaked at 121 degrees Monday ‚Äî a hot start to August after the hottest July ever recorded globally. Most of Southern California will see a significant cooling trend as the week continues. In the Los Angeles area, the weather has stayed relatively cool. No heat records have been broken since the state‚Äôs record-hot July came to an end. As August continues, experts advise residents to keep an eye on temperatures and limit their outdoor activities, hydrate and monitor children, elderly people and animals accordingly. üì∏: Gina Ferazzi

Adam Litwin‚Äôs lab coat didn‚Äôt look like the others. He observed surgery but never treated a patient himself. He parked in the doctors‚Äô lot with a pilfered pass. For months, he posed as a UCLA surgery resident, until the truth came out and he was sent to jail for two months. Litwin was not, in fact, a student. Just an aspiring doctor blinded by the love of medicine. Now, 20 years later, you might find him in a doctors‚Äô office ‚Å†‚Äî legitimately. Adam Litwin has graduated from medical school and is an MD in the United States, hoping to find a residency program that will admit him. Visit the link in our bio to learn about his turnaround and the challenges he still faces. üì∏: @pinaristekphoto

üòúü§ê One home in Manhattan Beach is sporting a bright paint job decorated with two giant emojis. Frustrated homeowners and renters in the El Porto neighborhood plan to raise their concerns again at a City Council meeting, marking the latest chapter of a saga that began in May. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm trying not to offend anybody,‚Äù Kidd said of the #emoijhouse. ‚ÄúI did it for the purpose of being happy, being positive, and I think it‚Äôs cute and quirky and kind of funny, and certainly was a time for the emoji.‚Äù üì∏: @kentnish

Trump abandoned his efforts to add a citizenship question to the 2020 census, but officials are bracing for a record undercount, especially among Latino children. Census data is used to distribute nearly $900 billion in annual federal funding. Latino children, who disproportionately live in poverty, are among the most in need of help, so the impacts of an undercount could be far-reaching. Many people in places like Laredo, Texas, are concerned that census information could be used to facilitate deportations. But in spite of their fears, some in Laredo say they take pride in having their children counted in the census. It represents an official acknowledgement of their existence and role in the U.S. üì∏: @callaghan_ohare

With ‚ÄúBeloved‚Äù and other writings, Toni Morrison gave voice to the silences in the past and created some of the most memorable characters in American literature. Singing, keening, praising, mourning, laughing, crying and loving, they fill her pages in a resounding chorus that captures the tragic and joyful complexion of life and race in this country. Now Morrison‚Äôs voice is silent after she died Monday night in New York at the age of 88. Winner of the Nobel Prize in literature and a Pulitzer Prize, and recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom, @toni.morrison was one of the country‚Äôs most celebrated writers. üì∏: Guillermo Arias / Associated Press

The 18 parishioners at St. Madeleine Sophie Barat Catholic Church didn‚Äôt need any more setbacks as they waited for Sunday Mass to start last week. The parish attendance had decreased greatly in recent years. Their priest was 30 minutes late that day. And they were recovering from the powerful #Ridgecrest earthquakes that left cracks in the walls and damage to statues and icons. The church is said to ‚Äúproject a sense of eternity,‚Äù contrasting the ‚Äúinfinite vastness of the surrounding desert.‚Äù But now, the parishioners don‚Äôt know how their worship will have to change because of the danger the building presents after the #earthquake. üì∏: @bvanderbrug

Gold Point, Nev., has a population of 6. One of them runs the inn. It‚Äôs not exactly his calling. For decades, the 73-year-old Bronx-born cowboy Walt Kremin has staked his claim in this forgotten mining town, which in the last century has seen its population dwindle from 1,000 to just six, including Kremin. But for some oddball reason, strangers keep showing up to nose around this high-desert outpost 180 miles north of Las Vegas. Some need a bed for the night and so Kremin, well, he guesses he‚Äôll oblige them. Kremin, you see, is something of a reluctant innkeeper. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt like making beds,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúI also know that I wouldn‚Äôt sleep on sheets somebody else slept on. So the beds get made.‚Äù üì∏: @davidjaybecker

A man armed with a rifle went on a rampage in a busy shopping center in the Texas border city of #ElPaso on Saturday, killing 20 people and wounding at least 26 others before police took him into custody. Real estate investors Heidi Roberts and John Betz have provided beds for 98 homeless people. Under their new nonprofit Haaven, they plan to house 480 more in the next year. They see themselves as non-expert homeless activists and unabashedly predict that they will produce housing faster than what‚Äôs available through the conventional, nonprofit model ‚Äî and at a fraction of the cost to the public. The finances work because they will rent each bedroom in each five-bedroom duplex to two people, creating a dorm-like setting that has been frowned upon by mainstream homeless advocates, but makes market-rate housing affordable to those living on scant Social Security benefits or other income. üì∏: @kentnish

üõ¥ While traveling a mile by scooter is better than driving the same distance by car, it‚Äôs worse than biking, walking or taking a bus ‚Äî the modes of transportation that scooters most often replace. That‚Äôs primarily because of the energy-intensive materials that go into making the vehicles, and because of the driving required to collect, charge, and redistribute them. ‚ÄúThat actual trip somebody‚Äôs taking on the #scooter ‚Äî that‚Äôs pretty green,‚Äù said Juan Matute, the deputy director of the UCLA Institute of Transportation Studies. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs not green is everything you don‚Äôt see.‚Äù üì∏: @genaro4707

Happy birthday, James Baldwin! The author known for novels ‚ÄúGiovanni's Room,‚Äù ‚ÄúIf Beale Street Could Talk,‚Äù and other works was born 95 years ago today in New York on Aug. 2, 1924. He passed away at the age of 63 on Dec. 1, 1987. #JamesBaldwin was in the forefront of the civil rights movement for a time during the 1960s, especially when he published his book of essays, ‚ÄúThe Fire Next Time.‚Äù Here‚Äôs an excerpt: ‚ÄúIf we ‚Ä¶ do not falter in our duty now, we may be able, handful that we are, to end the racial nightmare, and achieve our country, and change the history of the world.‚Äù üì∏: @latimesphotos

üö¢ The icebreaker #PolarStar slogs 11,500 miles from Seattle to Antarctica yearly to reach scientific bases. Each time the ship makes the journey, it falls apart. The only U.S. ship capable of bludgeoning through heavy ice, it is the neglected 43-year-old stepchild of the U.S. military industrial complex. While Russia will soon have more than 50 #icebreakers, the ship lumbers on as a Cold War relic. The Coast Guard announced that a company would build a new heavy icebreaker by 2024 for $746 million. Still, commanders and allies in Congress say the U.S. will need more icebreakers as #climatechange reshapes the polar regions. üì∏: Chief Petty Officer Nick Ameen / @uscg

Needles, California wants to be a 2nd Amendment ‚Äòsanctuary city‚Äô for guns and ammunition. ‚ÄúFor so long we‚Äôve had to deal with the laws as they are,‚Äù said Mayor Jeff Williams. ‚ÄúIt was time to stand up and say, ‚ÄòEnough.‚Äô‚Äù What the small town wants would seem a tough ask in a state with widespread support for gun control -- and never more so than after now-familiar mass shootings. But for officials in Needles, taking such a pro-gun stance offers a means to save a sporadically struggling town.‚ÄúWe do feel neglected,‚Äù said Rick Daniels, the town‚Äôs city manager. üì∏: @pixtakerirfan

For more than 15 years, a man known only as ‚ÄúSixty-Six Garage‚Äù laid in his hospital bed unidentified and unconscious. Aduke African Cuisine has been Aduke Oluwafunmilayo Oyetibo‚Äôs goal since arriving in the United States six years ago. Families arrived outside of Gilroy City Hall Monday for a vigil in memory of the victims of the Gilroy Garlic Festival shooting. The vigil was organized by Daniel Almeida, 30, an electrician who lives in Gilroy. He created a Facebook group at 9 a.m. Monday, and interest grew so quickly that he said he left work to spend the day putting the event together. An outsider might not see much to feel optimistic about in the city of Flint, Michigan. Jocelyn Ramirez is the founder and owner of @TodoVerde, a catering company that makes plant-based dishes inspired by her Latin American roots. It‚Äôs not easy to score an invitation to @magiccastleofficial. A shooting at the #GilroyGarlicFestival on Sunday evening left at least three dead and 15 injured, sending hundreds of terrified visitors running for their lives. Authorities said police officers fatally shot the assailant, but they were continuing to investigate whether he had an accomplice. ‚ÄúI feel really scared,‚Äù said Taylor Pellegrini, 25, who favors the festival for its rich food and music. ‚ÄúIt makes me not want to go anywhere anymore.‚Äù üì∏: @kentnish

In 2016, the LAPD created a volunteer force to patrol neighborhoods and deter property crimes. Putting volunteers on the streets to watch for suspicious activity, officials said, would free up officers to focus on the crime fight. Volunteers range from college students to people in their eighties. They do not carry guns. Instead, they use radios or phones to report information directly to officers. Now, the program wants to recruit 5,000 individuals to serve at least eight hours a month. ‚ÄúWe see this as a benefit,‚Äù said Deputy Chief Jorge Rodriguez, commanding officer of the Valley Bureau. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre our partners. They get to see what police do. It‚Äôs a win-win situation. It is a force multiplier.‚Äù üì∏: Mel Melcon

Former special counsel Robert Mueller testified before two house committees today, his first time answering questions in public since taking over the Russia investigation more than two years ago. ‚ÄúThe former special counsel‚Äôs highly anticipated testimony before Congress did not deliver the sort of splashy moment that circulates on cable TV. Ahead of the show's series finale, 'Jane the Virgin' showrunner and creator Jennie Snyder Urman is ready to say goodbye. South Korean voice actor and "YouTube Dad" Mun Jung-ho, has amassed a dedicated and loyal subscriber base of those he refers to as his virtual sons and daughters, ranging in age from school-age teens to those in their 30s with their own children. For the two dozen migrant children living inside a small church on the outskirts of Ciudad Juarez, Mexico, most days go like this: Breakfast at 8 a.m., dinner at 6 p.m., and hours of nothing in between. There is no school, and except for a handful of worn Bibles, there are no books. Dangers abound in the surrounding hills, so most haven‚Äôt left the razor-wire-ringed compound in weeks or even months. Many have been waiting for months for their chance to request political asylum in the United States. A Trump administration policy allows only a handful of asylum seekers to pass through ports of entry at the U.S. border each day. üì∏: Gary Coronado

One of the advantages of living in Los Angeles is the ability to get away from it all without too much of a drive. The Mueller report is the summer‚Äôs sleeper hit. Around the country, these epic readings of a historic, consequential and often misunderstood government document have become a trend. Marcy Lyles, a single mother of three boys, has been trying to break into the cannabis business for a while now. We accepted the offer. But I‚Äôm losing faith in my city. They don‚Äôt care about us. It‚Äôs terrible.‚Äù üì∏: @alschaben

Friends or relatives are coming to Los Angeles for the first time. They want to see the Hollywood sign, check out the beach scene in Santa Monica or Venice, and visit the Getty or the Broad. At Tito‚Äôs Tacos in Culver City,  there are always customers lined up outside. Jasper and Vjera Watts, along with their two young children, are trying to live a plastic-free life. It isn't easy. No matter where they go ‚Äî from school and the office to the mall, airport or park ‚Äî everyone travels with a stainless steel water bottle and his or her own utensils. ‚ÄúMy motivation is to leave a better world for our kids,‚Äù Jasper says. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs our job to make smart decisions as consumers, and to educate the next generation, or the situation is only going to get worse.‚Äù üì∏: Gina Ferazzi

The relationship between ICE and local law enforcement has long been delicate. Since Trump took office, it has grown only more tenuous, as police grapple with maintaining communication with ICE while also balancing being transparent with community and city leaders. It‚Äôs been longstanding LAPD policy not to enforce federal immigration law, fearing those actions would make those here illegally too afraid to cooperate in crime fighting. In 1987, the Los Angeles Police Department embarked on a major crackdown on homeless encampments on skid row. In response, Mayor Tom Bradley proposed a temporary site to relocate the homeless. On June 15, 1987, the urban campground opened. Within two weeks, about 500 homeless were at the site. Social service agencies sought to help. Schooling and daycare were provided for the children. But the site was temporary ‚Äì it closed on Sept. 25, 1987. Times photographer Ken Lubas shot this photo of Jose Lopez shampoos his hair with the help of a garden hose at the campground. He was cleaning up before going on a job search. #tbt

The Alamo Drafthouse chain of movie theaters is opening its first location in Southern California this week. The necessity of stockpiling supplies became more pronounced after twin earthquakes rocked Southern California, yet many still fail to prepare, experts say. There are relatively easy things that can be done, such as packing emergency kits with food and supplies, to more complicated ‚Äî and expensive ‚Äî tasks, including earthquake insurance, retrofitting homes and strengthening structures against violent shaking. The reality that a similar-sized #earthquake in Los Angeles, a far more densely populated area than Ridgecrest, would do significant damage resonated with some in the days after the twin quakes. üì∏: @genaro4707

What was it like for the first women of space? As we approach the 50th anniversary of the moon landing, the L.A. Times is celebrating the Women of the #Apollo Mission. Behind the moon landing were the human computers -- many of whom were women who went unrecognized for their part in the mission‚Äôs success for decades.  Swipe left to see some of the women who made it possible. üì∏: Christine Darden: Courtesy photo; Poppy Northcutt: PhotoQuest / Getty Images;

The Mt. Wilson Observatory is the Fenway Park of 20th century #astronomy, a thrilling place where contrarians helped change the plot lines of human existence. Despite its significance, Mt. Wilson was forgotten for a while, a victim of the city lights that ruined its darkroom ambience. Now, thanks mostly to donations and volunteers, this diamond on the hill is enjoying a bit of a renaissance. In many ways, Mt. Wilson was a stepping stone to the Apollo mission for NASA, and today it stands as a rallying point for L.A. residents to gaze out at the moon, which if all goes well might be our 51st state. üì∏: Gina Ferazzi

50 years ago today marks the launch date of #Apollo11, the historic spaceflight that landed humans on the moon. The Apollo 11 astronauts, from right, Neil Armstrong, Michael Collins and Edwin A. "Buzz" Aldrin Jr. appeared in a cheerful mood as they left the Manned Spacecraft Operations Building to enter the transfer van that took them to Pad 39 to enter the Command Module on July 16, 1969, at Cape Kennedy, Fla. üì∏: @AP

Los Angeles is trying to lead the world in fighting climate change, but a coal plant in Utah has been L.A.‚Äôs single largest power source for three decades. Intermountain Power Plant will shut down in 2025, though L.A. is preparing to build a natural gas-fired power plant in its place, even as it works to shut down three gas plants in its own backyard. After the collapse of a nearly 30-year partnership with the maker of the world-famous #Sriracha sauce and a multimillion-dollar lawsuit with the company, Craig Underwood is still betting on his farm‚Äôs peppers. A jury recently awarded $23.3 million to Underwood Ranches after a bitter lawsuit with Huy Fong Foods Inc., the manufacturer of the wildly popular Sriracha in the signature green-capped bottle. Lakers. üì∏: @yamphoto

‚öΩÔ∏è This Los Angeles‚Äô all-Latina club is trying to change the face of women‚Äôs soccer. Downtown, as it‚Äôs commonly known, is filled and fueled by 175 girls trying to crack the grass ceiling. While West Adams might not be called trendy, its art, history and architecture make it the hotspot that it is. West Adams is facing gentrification and the increasing prices that comes with it, but it still manages to hold on to a feeling of authenticity. üì∏: @jlcvisuals

More and more young people are picking up crystals over crosses as they leave traditional religion behind for spiritual practice. ‚ÄúAnd no, they don‚Äôt particularly care if you think it‚Äôs ‚Äòwoo-woo‚Äô or weird,‚Äù @Jess_mag writes. ‚ÄúMost millennials claim to not take any of it too seriously themselves. @lisarinna always wanted to be famous. With the #RealHousewivesofBeverlyHills, she got her wish. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never been more famous than I am at this point, because of the show,‚Äù Rinna said matter-of-factly. üì∏: @bigmac857

‚ÄúThe first one was devastating,‚Äù said Karen Byrd, whose niece Brooke Thompson is pictured playing on a sleeping bag. The reality of sea level rise has California cornered. The coastline is eroding with every tide and storm, but everything built before we knew better ‚Äî Pacific Coast Highway, multimillion-dollar homes in Malibu, the rail line to San Diego ‚Äî is fixed in place with nowhere to go. The state has both no time and too much time to act, spiraling into paralyzing battles over the why, who, when and how. It‚Äôs not too late for Californians to lead the way and plan ahead for sea level rise, experts say, if only there is the will to accept the bigger picture. That includes acknowledging the truth: The ocean always wins.
üì∏: @ccole_photo

The small town of Trona suffered more damage from Friday night‚Äôs 7.1 magnitude earthquake. The town had no electricity and no running water as of early Saturday morning. A magnitude 7.1 earthquake struck Southern California on Friday night, the second major temblor in less than two days. The quake was centered near #Ridgecrest, the location of the July Fourth 6.4 magnitude temblor that was the largest in nearly 20 years. Our photographer @pixtakerirfan is in Ridgecrest covering the earthquake and captured these photos.

üéá Spectators gathered at the water‚Äôs edge and joined thousands lining the beach to watch fireworks explode over the pier during the 115th annual fireworks show themed "Sweet Land of Liberty!‚Äù in Huntington Beach, Calif., on July 4, 2019. üì∏: @alschaben

The Independence Day magnitude 6.4 earthquake had an epicenter in the remote Searles Valley but was felt as far away as Las Vegas and Phoenix. The durian is no ordinary fruit. Its thorny cantaloupe-sized husk looks like a hedgehog crossed with an avocado. Tan Eow Chong, a clever Malaysian farmer, has made a fortune off the fruit. What defines durian fruit, however, is its overpowering sulfuric scent, which has led to bans from public transportation and the occasional evacuation of buildings. But for the fruit‚Äôs admirers, the stench is part of the allure. ‚ÄúIf it doesn‚Äôt stink, it‚Äôs not durian,‚Äù Tan said. Tan, now 58, has seen his revenue grow tenfold in the six years since he began exporting durians to China. Now, among locals on this lush island west of the Malay peninsula, Tan is the Durian King. üì∏: @suzanneleephoto

Meet Carly Rose: Child prodigy, reality TV flameout and your next indie-pop queen. @carlyrosemusic finished ‚ÄúX Factor‚Äù in second place in 2012 at the age of 13; now, 20, the USC music student is relaunching her music career with the release of a new song, ‚ÄúBirds & Bees." üì∏: @jaylclendenin

Lee Iacocca, an ambitious salesman who dominated the automobile industry like nobody since Henry Ford, died Tuesday at 94. He‚Äôs remembered for his powerful speaking ability and starring role in Chrysler commercials where he‚Äôd declare, ‚ÄúIf you can find a better car, buy it.‚Äù He died in his Bel-Air home from complications of Parkinson‚Äôs disease. üì∑: Gary Friedman

The Manor, a 56,500-square-foot chateau in Holmby Hills, has sold for $120 million ‚Äî the highest price of any L.A. County residence to date. A queer bar in Mexico City was attacked, first with fists, then with fire. The owners faced a decision: close La Ca√±ita to protect themselves and their patrons, or fight on? In Berkeley, California, a mural depicting presidential candidate Kamala Harris on a wall at Thousand Oaks Elementary School is a reminder of the senator‚Äôs childhood in the city. The CROWN Act was approved by the state Assembly last week and would outlaw policies that punish black employees and students for their hairstyles. If signed by Gov. Gavin Newsom, the bill would legally protect people in workplaces and K-12 public schools by prohibiting the enforcement of grooming policies that disproportionately affect people of color, particularly black people. This includes bans on certain hairstyles, such as Afros, braids, twists, cornrows and dreadlocks. ‚ÄúIt's important to me as a black woman,‚Äù said Kari Williams, pictured, who owns Mahogany Hair Revolution, a hair salon in Beverly Hills. ‚ÄúOur skin color and our hair have been used as ways to continue to keep us disenfranchised.‚Äù üì∏: @dania_maxwell

@spidermanmovie "Far From Home" closes the third phase of the @marvel Cinematic Universe. For Tom Holland, at 23, he has been living his own dream playing Spider-Man for a significant chunk of the past four years. @tomholland2013 is the third actor to don the superhero‚Äôs spandex in a live-action feature ‚Äî but quickly made the iconic character his own when he debuted in 2016‚Äôs ‚Äú Captain American: Civil War.‚Äù ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a level of pressure because people really want to know what‚Äôs next,‚Äù Holland said. ‚ÄúEveryone‚Äôs fallen in love with those characters for the past 10 years, and all of a sudden people we know and love and feel we have a connection to, we‚Äôve said goodbye to forever.‚Äù üì∏: @jlcvisuals

Cardi B makes clear in her latest single how she‚Äôs feeling these days about engaging with the professional news media. Guadalajara long has been a bastion of Catholicism. For nearly 100 years, it also has been the cradle of La Luz del Mundo, the largest evangelical church in Mexico. Since his arrest, parishioners have reported being verbally assaulted and people have vandalized churches. ‚ÄúThere has long been tension between Catholics and members of La Luz del Mundo,‚Äù said one researcher. Visit the link in our bio to read more from @brittny_ariel on La Luz del Mundo. üì∏ @gcoronadophoto
